title: Add real-world public/shared computer login scenario to Run Scenario workflow

requirements.summary: Add a new real-world keylogger-awareness scenario to the existing Test Scenarios panel with working Run Scenario, learning content, and quiz support.
acceptanceCriteria: A new scenario appears in the existing Test Scenarios list (frontend/src/components/TestScenariosPanel.tsx) with a name, short description, and expected outcome.

Clicking “Run Scenario” on the new scenario triggers the existing runScenario flow (frontend/src/hooks/useSimulationState.ts) and visibly plays back the scenario text into the simulation input (no manual typing required).
The scenario has associated learning content returned by getScenarioContent (frontend/src/lib/scenarioLearningContent.ts) and it renders correctly in the collapsible learning-content section.
The scenario has an associated quiz entry (frontend/src/lib/scenarioQuizzes.ts) and clicking “Take Test” opens the quiz modal for that scenario without errors.

file_operations.description: Add a new scenario entry (e.g., id like "public-shared-computer-login") to the existing scenarios array with name, short description, and Expected label so it appears in the current Test Scenarios grid. This will continue to use existing shadcn-ui Button and Collapsible compositions for learning content and actions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a ScenarioContent entry keyed by the new scenario id, with a defensive, awareness-focused title and content tailored to a public/shared computer login context so getScenarioContent returns it and the existing collapsible section renders it.
Add a ScenarioQuiz entry keyed by the new scenario id (5 questions) so getScenarioQuiz can supply quiz content and ScenarioQuizModal opens without errors when "Take Test" is clicked.

requirements.summary: Provide educational, privacy-safe preset text for the new scenario that still produces a meaningful risk/auto-block outcome when run.
acceptanceCriteria: The new scenario’s preset text is included in the runScenario mapping in frontend/src/hooks/useSimulationState.ts.
The preset text does not include real-looking secrets (e.g., actual credit card/SSN formats) and stays in a defensive/awareness tone.
Running the scenario produces a non-trivial outcome in the simulation (e.g., Medium/High risk or auto-block if enabled), consistent with the scenario’s “Expected” label shown in the UI.

file_operations.description: Extend the existing runScenario scenarios mapping with the new scenario id and preset playback text that is realistic but privacy-safe (no real credentials), using password-like patterns/keywords to reliably trigger Medium/High risk and (if enabled) auto-block during the existing character-by-character playback flow.
